intro: Koanophyllon villosum subsp. villosum, commonly known as the hairy leaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant is distinguished by its woolly, hairy leaves and yellow ray flowers that bloom in the spring. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and local biodiversity.
